42 /**
43  * @file mcu.h
44  * @author foxBMS Team
45  * @date 2019-02-19 (date of creation)
46  * @updated 2023-02-03 (date of last update)
47  * @version v1.5.0
48  * @ingroup DRIVERS
49  * @prefix MCU
50  *
51  * @brief Headers for the driver for the MCU module.
52  *
53  */
54 
55 #ifndef FOXBMS__MCU_H_
56 #define FOXBMS__MCU_H_
57 
58 /*========== Includes =======================================================*/
59 #include <stdbool.h>
60 #include <stdint.h>
61 
62 /*========== Macros and Definitions =========================================*/
63 
64 /**
65  * @brief largest pin number that exists in TMS570LC4357
66  * @details Checked in the data sheet spnu563a: The largest pin number that is
67  * used is 31.
68 */
69 #define MCU_LARGEST_PIN_NUMBER (31u)
70 
71 /**
72  * @brief maximum number of channels measured by the ADC1
73  * @details Checked in the data sheet spnu563a: ADC1 supports 32 channels
74  */
75 #define MCU_ADC1_MAX_NR_CHANNELS (32u)
76 
77 #ifndef UNITY_UNIT_TEST
78 /** Address of Free Running Counter 0 (FRC0) */
79 #define MCU_RTI_CNT0_FRC0_REG (*((volatile uint32_t *)0xFFFFFC10u))
80 #else
81 extern volatile uint32_t MCU_RTI_CNT0_FRC0_REG;
82 #endif
83 
84 /*========== Extern Constant and Variable Declarations ======================*/
85 
86 /*========== Extern Function Prototypes =====================================*/
87 
88 /**
89  * @brief Wait blocking a certain time in microseconds.
90  * @details This function uses the Free Running Counter 0 (FRC0) to generate a
91  * delay in microseconds. It does not modify anything related to the
92  * counter. This counter is already used by FreeRTOS.
93  * @param delay_us time in microseconds to wait
94  */
95 extern void MCU_Delay_us(uint32_t delay_us);
96 
97 /**
98  * @brief Get the current value of the Free Running Counter 0 (FRC0)
99  * @details This function returns the current value of the Free Running
100  * Counter 0 (FRC0). This counter is already used by FreeRTOS and this
101  * function does nothing more than accessing this value.
102  * @returns the current counter value of FRC0
103  */
104 extern uint32_t MCU_GetFreeRunningCount(void);
105 
106 /**
107  * @brief Convert the counter value FRC0 to a time in microseconds
108  * @details This function applies a scaling factor to the FRC0 counter value,
109  * which can be retrieved with #MCU_GetFreeRunningCount() so that this
110  * value represents microseconds. Typically this used with counter
111  * differences in order to get timing estimates on microsecond-level.
112  * @param[in] count counter value of the FRC0
113  * @returns equivalent time in microseconds
114  */
115 extern uint32_t MCU_ConvertFrcDifferenceToTimespan_us(uint32_t count);
116 
117 /**
118  * @brief Checks if a timeout in microseconds has elapsed
119  * @details First the function #MCU_GetFreeRunningCount() must be called
120  * to retrieve the current value of the free running counter.
121  * This function checks if the time given as parameter has elapsed
122  * since the counter was retrieved.
123  * @param[in] startCounter counter value of the FRC0, used as starting point
124  * @param[in] timeout_us time in microseconds to check against
125  * @returns true if timeout has elapsed, false otherwise
126  */
127 extern bool MCU_IsTimeElapsed(uint32_t startCounter, uint32_t timeout_us);
128 
129 /*========== Externalized Static Functions Prototypes (Unit Test) ===========*/
130 #ifdef UNITY_UNIT_TEST
131 #endif
132 
133 #endif /* FOXBMS__MCU_H_ */
